result.execSummary:
The defendant Spenser Allen Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Spenser Allen Weber

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

2:05 PM Defendant Spenser Allen Weber in court, in custody.  Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in court for Spenser Allen Weber.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Hatch: Dismiss/Read in Ct#1, guilty to Ct#2-6. 9 months jail on Ct#2-4, 90 days on Ct#6. Court costs ($543) on Ct#2 and #6 and court costs ($443) on Ct#3-5. No contact except by phone only with B.M.K. and K.A.W. 78 days credit. Atty Helgeson and Def agree. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant pleas guilty for Ct#2,3,4,5,6. Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct#2-6; dismiss/read in Ct#1. DA Hatch and Atty Helgeson address sentencing. Defense asks for contact with son (K.A.W). DA Hatch objects to request. Court takes judicial notice of 21FA126-no orders regarding custody/placement. Court orders: 9 months jail; concurrent and with prison sentence in Ct#2-5, 90 days jail in Ct#6; concurrent and with any other sentencing serving. 78 days credit and served with good time. Court costs ($543 in Ct#2 and Ct#6, $443 in Ct#3-5) due in 6 months, no contact except by phone with B.M.K and K.A.W, during the pendency of these cases. Provide DNA sample. Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 2:40
BK
Status conference on October 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Off record for scheduling.  Information filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Defendant waives further reading of the information. Defendant pleads not guilty to all counts.  Not guilty plea received by the court .  Bond to continue.

10:30 AM Defendant Spenser Allen Weber in court, in custody.   Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in court for Spenser Allen Weber.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy  John  Harris is sworn and takes the stand.  Hatch exams Harris.  Harris identifies defendant.  Helgeson x-exams Harris.  Harris is excused.  Hatch gives argument and asks for finding of probable cause and bind over.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the Defendant probably committed a felony. Court binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:05 PM Spenser Allen Weber appears from Jail via video, Atty Philip A. Helgeson appears by phone,  DA Halle E. Hatch for State of Wisconsin. Victim appears by phone. Atty Helgeson and DA Hatch would like to reset the hearing, DE is in agreement. Waive the time limits. Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements. . Court will reset the 8/9/22 PH.  Court adjourned at 1:15 PM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:03 PM Defendant Spenser Allen Weber appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Travis Satorius appears by phone, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appears by phone.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. DE does not qualify for PD. DA Hatch is requesting a $250.00 CB w/conditions of No contact w/B.M.K., K.A.W., their residence and AS., objection to the cash, ADA Hatch objects. Court orders cash bond as requested w/conditions requested. Court confirms address and phone number.  Court adjourned at 3:15 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
